newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's CNI sees up to 3.0 pct GDP growth for '96.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's CNI sees up to 3.0 pct GDP growth for '96.

text.p: Brazil's gross domestic product is set to rise 2.5-3.0 percent in 1996, and 4.0-5.0 percent in 1997, said Jose Guilherme dos Reis, head of the economic department at the private National Industry Confederation (CNI).
The CNI lowered its forecast for industrial output growth to 1.5 percent in 1996 from a previous 2.0 percent.
But dos Reis said stronger than expected growth in agriculture and other sectors led the CNI to forecast GDP growth of up to 3.0 percent, higher than a previous forecast of 2.5 percent.
Dos Reis said the CNI expected Brazil to end 1996 with a $2.0-3.0 billion trade deficit, a figure likely to rise in 1997.

The deficit would rise as a natural consequence of growth in the economy as a whole, he said, adding that measures to stimulate exports, such as their recent exemption from so-called ICMS tax, would not narrow the deficit.
